abstract: Shiite town of Sitra, Bahrain, is seen by many as a barometer of the true state of conflict in the polarized nation; no one in Sitra, where clashes erupt nightly and the streets are strewn with rubble, seems to agree with government suggestions that Bahrain's crisis has ended.
snippet: Government officials today suggest that the crisis has ended in Bahrain. No one in Sitra seems to agree.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Government officials today suggest that the crisis has ended in Bahrain. No one in Sitra seems to agree.

headline.main: In Rubble-Strewn Sitra, Faces of the Young Foretell a Grim Future for Bahrain
headline.print_headline: In Rubble-Strewn Sitra, Faces of the Young Foretell a Grim Future for Bahrain
headline.seo: In Sitra, Faces of Young Foretell Grim Future for Bahrain
